title: "Schoolbook" versions of classic Monotype typefaces
content:
Hi everyone  
I've seen “Schoolbook” versions of Monotype faces (notably Plantin, Bembo and Gill Sans) pop up here and there in the past few years (indeed, I think this fashion has already been discussed on this forum) but I can't find any piece of information about the origins of these particular fonts. Were they hot metal fonts before "going digital” ? When were they designed, and by whom ?
author: Celeste

comments.content: If I recall corectly, the gill sans schoolbook version existed as hot metal so it could be a european alternative for Futura.
Oh, really ? Does someone know a website listing original serial numbers for hot metal versions of Monotype faces ?
